revised_title: Impurity Effects on Superconducting Penetration Depth and a New Phenomenological Theory
tldr: The author conducted experiments on the effects of impurities, specifically indium, on the penetration depth in superconducting tin. They discovered that adding impurity significantly alters the penetration depth in both zero magnetic field and when a magnetic field is applied. This finding challenges the London theory of superconductivity. A new phenomenological theory is proposed, which adequately describes the observed effects of impurities on the penetration depth and provides an explanation for the absolute magnitude and anisotropy of the penetration depth in pure tin.
